question.body: Which system does not contain smooth muscle cells?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This may seem like a trick question, since we immediately think of cardiac muscle cells, but the blood vessel walls have smooth muscle cells.
Incorrect. Single-unit smooth muscle cells help move things along the gastrointestinal tract.
Incorrect. Multiunit smooth muscle cells are found in the respiratory system.
Correct. The central nervous system doesnâ€™t include any smooth muscle even though it is involved with regulation of signals that can stimulate muscle contraction.

part.hint: Smooth muscle cells are found throughout the body and help with directing and moving materials through the body.
Which system is not associated with internal fluid movement?
